extendedIngredients.name: chex wheat cereal
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups honey-sweetened puffed wheat cereal, such as Honey Smacks

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
nutri grain cereal
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups toasted honey whole-grain oat cereal, such as Honey Nut Cheerios

extendedIngredients.name: nuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups salted mixed nuts, roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for greasing

recipes.title: Honey-Nut Cereal Treats

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Treat. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Line a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with enough foil so that there's a 2-inch overhang on all sides. Grease the foil with butter.                          Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the marshmallows and honey and cook, stirring occasionally, until the marshmallows melt completely, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the almond butter and vanilla. Add the whole oat cereal, puffed wheat cereal and 1 cup of the chopped mixed nuts. Stir with a rubber spatula, making sure to scrape up the bottom, until the cereal is completely coated. Transfer to the prepared baking dish and pat down into an even layer. Scatter the remaining 1/2 cup of chopped nuts on top and press into the top (use the bottom of a measuring cup to help). Let sit at room temperature until firm, about 30 minutes.                          Cut into 24 bars. Store at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

steps.step: Line a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with enough foil so that there's a 2-inch overhang on all sides. Grease the foil with butter.
Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the marshmallows and honey and cook, stirring occasionally, until the marshmallows melt completely, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in the almond butter and vanilla.
Add the whole oat cereal, puffed wheat cereal and 1 cup of the chopped mixed nuts. Stir with a rubber spatula, making sure to scrape up the bottom, until the cereal is completely coated.
Transfer to the prepared baking dish and pat down into an even layer. Scatter the remaining 1/2 cup of chopped nuts on top and press into the top (use the bottom of a measuring cup to help).
Let sit at room temperature until firm, about 30 minutes.
Cut into 24 bars. Store at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
